website_summaries.verdict: Low-priced film and slide scanner that gives you up to 22 megapixels of resolution in your scanned images.
pros: Handles many types of negatives and slides easily, including 35 millimeter, 110, 126, and Super 8
Does not require a computer to be attached
Smaller unit versus some others, so it's easy to take with you
Adjustable maximum resolution setting of either 14 megapixels or 22 megapixels, so you can save storage space as needed
cons: Only supports a memory card up to 32 gigabytes in size to store your images
Tiny LCD screen at 2.4 inches diagonally

customer_reviews.title: Got to look at some super old negatives of my family
customer_reviews.text: I put the negative in like the directions said and I could see the photo in color and it was an old photo, so that was pretty neat. I can't wait to dig out some more negatives of photos I have given away over the years and see them again. Good price and I am pleased with the outcome!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yayy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and quick set up. I love this thing. It was like magic.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby dole

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and a Christmas gift and my brother was ecstatic! It was amazing to see how clear and concise the photos looked though they were taken nearly 10 years ago when technology was not anywhere near as advanced. Would definitely recommend purchasing this!
customer_reviews.author: eeneal

customer_reviews.title: DigitNow 22mp Film Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Item is a little smaller than I expected. However, it is easy to use and works great. For the money, it was a good purchase and shipping was very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Alec Colley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Fast, good quality scans straight from negatives. Feeder is a bit clumsy but workable. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: SERGE JONNAERT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to set-up and use. It's a good thing because the manual was not very detailed. It took a little trial and error to figure out the most efficient way to copy my 35mm slides. Once I did that, I copied about 400 slides in a short period of time. There are better products on the market but they.are much more expensive. For the money, this one can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Steve J.

customer_reviews.title: bad quality equipment
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get the scanner to capture the color accurately. The color is horrible and looks nothing like the slides I tried to scan. The color shift is so bizarre that it is impossible to describe.Tried to adjust the color but the scanner didn't respond and the color remained the same. Also the type size in the manual could be a little so it is easier to read. And the pictures illustrating the various steps are too small and dark to follow easily. What I want to know is how do I deal with what appears to be a faulty product? Is there any kind of a call center I can talk to?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received defective item. Neither manufacturer or Amazon will help.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get around to setting up the scanner until after the return window... big mistake. Right out of the box there was a cable missing. I searched my house and found a suitable cable, but the scanner turns on to a totally blank screen. The "manual" is terrible. I tried all of the different setup options. I contacted the manufacturer by email. They got back to me in 3 days and had no advice and won't replace the item. I can't find any way to actually contact Amazon for help. Not an inexpensive purchase and I guess it is going in the trash... Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Jones

customer_reviews.title: Product is unusable. DigitNow 22MP All-in-1 Film & Slide Scanner
customer_reviews.text: When the product came, I was reading the owner's manual and one of my granchildren inseted the slide tray in the product uside down. The product will not function with the tray upside down and the tray is locked inside. I have written Customer Service at Digit Now for help on two consecutive days and have received no reply. I am not impressed with either the product nor the company. When we finally got the slide tray inserted properly, the quality of the scanner was unsatisfactory. Colors were poor and images were blurred. This was a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Color accuracy unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps this was just a bad unit, but the color reproduction from slides was terrible, far too blue and could not be brought to anything near acceptable by the built in color adjustments. Using a digital camera to capture the image on the wall from a 50+ year old projector yielded superior results. It also does not scan 100% of the slide, estimate about 85%. Will return and save up for a higher quality unit.
customer_reviews.author: stvbck

customer_reviews.title: New review from previous bed review
customer_reviews.text: Previously wrote a review on this item and gave it a one (1) star. At the time I was not able to use voltage adapter and colors whereof. Just checked and the adapter seems to be working and I found that the film selection had changed. hen proper film selected it works ok. The reason I did not give a five (5) star is the fact that it seems you must go through set up for file each time you turn it off, a pain.
customer_reviews.author: John N Nash

customer_reviews.title: AMAZONS JUNK ITEM
customer_reviews.text: It’s a piece of Junk I downloaded 49 slides and now it won’t save anything. I would not recommend this product at all. This is what you see a white square with a yellow triangle with an astrich. I can’t use it at all now after one day it’s a defective product and I can’t believe Amazon carries it. Don’t buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Not for serious photographers.
customer_reviews.text: It scans negatives quickly and easily. It's intuitive. It's small and light. The image quality is so poor, it's laughable. To a serious photographer this gadget is practically worthless. I'd classify this as a toy or gimmick. Not quite junk, but close. If you want to turn your old slides and negatives into digital memories it's marginal. Showcasing your film photography achievements? No way!
customer_reviews.author: Ride4Life

customer_reviews.title: Memories
customer_reviews.text: I got married 18 years ago, all the photos are in film, while I was cleaning the storage of my house, I found all the negatives from that moment and I decided to look for a way to convert them to digital. I cannot be more happy with this device. It is easy to use and it cost less than a professional service. I told my mom about it and she told me that she has 8mm film so I will convert them into digital next time I see her. I will recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sada

customer_reviews.title: so glad to have found this on amazon and I can ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been putting off this project for so long now mostly because of the costs associated with it, I thought I would have to take my negatives somewhere to have them converted, so glad to have found this on amazon and I can just do it myself and have everything digital, great little gadget to have.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment!  Colors are too far off!
customer_reviews.text: The directions for the device are confusing at best. The picture quality of the scan was actually pretty good. The "deal breaker" was the color balance! The scanned color was much too blue and the adjustments could not correct that to any acceptable degree. For me, this device is not usable. I will go back to my flat bed scanner. This device is not recommended by this user.
customer_reviews.author: Alchemist

customer_reviews.title: This is a simple machine that is difficult to learn.
customer_reviews.text: This machine does what it says it will do. I use it for slides - I have at least a thousand. It is ok to use to send the pics to your kids or put on Facebook. It scans quickly. It does no recognize that there is a memory card inserted. I scan into the memory and then connect it to my computer and upload into the computer. I find it wonky to use missing structions to delete pictures from its memory. I am still looking for seomthing of higher quality to scan easier and with higher quality. It does work for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Laquintano

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my husband. He likes it enough ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband. He likes it enough and it does what he needs it to but he said the directions are poorly written.
customer_reviews.author: kathy s.

customer_reviews.title: New Manual Please
customer_reviews.text: As several other reviews said, the user manual for this scanner is terrible. Obviously written in China by someone with rudimentary English and not edited. That aside, the scanner is fine given it’s price point. I am using it to digitize 40+ year old slides. Once I figured out how to work the scanner, the job went quickly. As far as I can tell it is capturing the slides faithfully. I am doing any editing on my computer though. For the money it does the job on slides.
customer_reviews.author: D. White

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is inexpensive and very easy to set up and use. The problem is, the picture quality is bad. Resolution is low (fuzzy unclear results) and the color balance is off. There is a way to adjust the color balance but it is difficult and doesn't work well. Overall I am disappointed, this unit is destined for the trash. However, if you just want a super-easy way to look at old negatives or slides, and you don't particularly care about quality, this item is one to consider.
customer_reviews.author: ddb

customer_reviews.title: Best converter ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is my favorite gift ever. I bought this for my parents so I could convert their old negatives into digital pics and then surprise them with a slideshow on our big screen tv for their anniversary. I am so happy to say, that this little machine works wonders!! It's not complicated and I'm able to transform these dusty old negatives into amazing photos with great quality. The colors are vibrant and much sharper than I had anticipated they would be. My parents are going to love this. I'll update with pics after the whole event!!
customer_reviews.author: E Morillo

customer_reviews.title: Great budget scanner
customer_reviews.text: I had a box full of old slides and negatives. Using this helped me easily view them and scan those that I wanted to keep. The scan quality is good for my needs, although the more discerning photo archivist may want better. My source slides and negatives are in pretty rough shape and this scanner makes pretty darned good digital versions and at this price you will get no complaints from me. As for ease of use, even a technologically challenged person could use this. The ease of use and the speed of scanning makes this a great solution for someone archiving old family photos.
customer_reviews.author: MikeSFCA

customer_reviews.title: Saving Those Treasures
customer_reviews.text: Generally the device works great as intended. I put several types of film/negatives/slides through it. Very happy with the results. The interface is clunky and took some diligence to understand and use. Go to other reviewers comments will be very helpful for you. They explain the process. Once you figure it out it becomes easy still a little clunky. Very happy about the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Antisocial

customer_reviews.title: Fairly easy to use after you learn it.
customer_reviews.text: I had many old photos and slides that I wanted to upload to my computer, so I chose this item due to its reasonable price. However, the instruction book seems to have been for another model, so it was a bit difficult to learn how to use it. But once I figured it out, loading slides and negative strips was fairly fast and easy. It does have a setting for high pixel count, and I was happy with a few photos, but there were others that we're grainy.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Wheeler Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Color
customer_reviews.text: For a highly rated item this scanner performed terribly. No relationship of scanned image (mostly black/white/yellow to the original image over many scans. Would require hours of color correction if even possible. Trash.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: (English as a Second Language) On screen icons aren't all that great or intuitive
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work OK. A couple of times, it kept hunting for proper exposure. Instructions seem to have been written by someone who is failing ESL. (English as a Second Language) On screen icons aren't all that great or intuitive. My biggest complaint is that many of my negatives are on "Advantix" film and they feed through the 135 film guide with a lot of slop.
customer_reviews.author: Geo Van

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Having 10 years worth of pictures done in 35 mm on my computer/digital frame is priceless. Even though the price was so cheap compared to getting a video shop to do 2000 pictures for us. Use the lint brush through the inside of the device after every pack of negatives. (Unless you want that antique picture look like the instagram app lol). Put the adapter in and just slide the negative through. You can begin moving to the next frame while the last pic is still saving. Do your photo editing in the computer and just leave the color/contrast etc alone on the machine. Do up the quality on the device though unless you want compressed photos.
customer_reviews.author: bviss

customer_reviews.title: Does 100% what it says.. but slowly
customer_reviews.text: It does work 100% as described.. The process of actually taking the photo is meticulous and extremely repetitive. I had to convert around 4,900 photos (both on rolls and cut strips) and by the time I hit the first 1000 it became apparent that you won’t be doing the conversion quickly. AND Most importantly, you absolutely need to let it finish saving the image before moving the strip or slide. Found out after when a few of my converted photos came out blurry.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Will not recognize or copy to SD card
customer_reviews.text: Unit would not recognize or copy to an SD card. Screen display indicated "No SD Card" I returned it and asked for a replacement. The second unit also did not recognize or copy to an SD card. I tried several SD cards. These cards could be read and copied to by other devices. All other features worked, and quality of photo/jpg is acceptable for the price of the unit. Shipping packaging was very poor. The first unit was in it's display box and was inside a padded envelope. The second unit had a shipping label attached to the display box and was shipped without padding or packaging.
customer_reviews.author: BackWoods

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money!
customer_reviews.text: My nana passed away a few years ago and she had tons of slides. We don’t have a slide projector so we just tried to hold them up to the light to see them. My mother doesn’t have any photos of herself when she was little, but because of this product she will now have over 300 childhood memories. I have to say for the price, this product is very easy to use and transferred all of photos very well! I cannot wait to see the look on her face on Christmas Day. The photos came out beautiful and she now has all of her memories printed in photos. Amazing product!! I’m very thankful they sell this!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless $100 purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very poor instructions on how to use; no diagrams about all the parts, what they look like, what other devices are required to make this functional. I am lost. I was so excited about the prospect of viewing, selecting slides and saving them digitally all in one fell swoop. But I can't figure out what I need to do, how the slides are loaded, etc.
customer_reviews.author: sharonrose

customer_reviews.title: This is ideal!
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on this fairly inexpensive model because of the positive reviews, and those positive reviews were justified! Small, simple to use, and even without fiddling with color adjustments, the results were outstanding. I love that you don't have to hook it up to a computer and mess with software. I didn't bother with the user's manual and had it figured out in about ten minutes. You scan a new slide in the length of time it takes you to push the old one out of the tray. If you get in a rhythm, you could easily do four or five a minute. This is the one to get!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Ottinger

customer_reviews.title: Best capture device for Photo Slides and Negatives!
customer_reviews.text: As I first tried this out, I have noticed that it was a negative photo like at first, but when I adjusted the film setting to slides, the picture came out beautifully well. Able to capture slides and saved it on to an SD card and with the photos captured, I even restore it using Photoshop software to make it look like new again. If you would like to turn your slides and negatives to digital photo files, this device is for you. I would recommend this project from Digitnow.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Plastic parts don't fit the plastic slots & it doesn't respond when a SD Card is fully inserted
customer_reviews.text: Feels like a cheap imitation - shows "No Card" - even when the appropriate 32mb card is fully inserted. Then, you can't get the card out again, since the slot is not really made to fit the card, and there's no way to get hold of the card to get it out - had to find a pair of jewellery pliers to extract it. Slide trays don't close properly with an appropriate size slide in them - you have to force them with the danger of breaking the whole thing. I was unable to scan a single slide with expensive contraption - returned it to seller. Recommend - don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn W. Henson

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed!
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved my 90 year-old father out of his home and stumbled across about 15 full slide carousels dating back to the early 60’s. Using this has been perfect for me to tackle converting all these slides to .jpgs. I work on the project when I have time and it’s easy to put down and come back to it. No steep learning curve. The only thing to remember is to put your SD card (not included) in upside-down as others have mentioned. Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Professional Cat Herder

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product. Unfortunately, I had to return the first scanner I received due to a faulty plug. I did contact the company first. They were quick to respond and help me determine that the plug was faulty and suggested I return it in exchange for a new one. I did and the 2nd one worked great. The color balance can be tricky but I was able to scan almost 200 negatives while watching TV in just a couple of hours. Attached is a photo from the scanner from 2004.
customer_reviews.author: K Jarmon

customer_reviews.title: Good for 35 mm but not for 126
customer_reviews.text: We got the 126 film. The adapter doesnt take it well. The top got chopped off. First photo is the film by itself. You see there is room above the head Second photo is in adapter. The top got chopped off Third is I manually adjusted the film to match with adapter but its on the 'rail'. I can't feed the film into this adatper
customer_reviews.author: S. Mak

customer_reviews.title: This is a good scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one even when I read pretty bad reviews about it. I loved this scanner. I went through my mom's old films (110 and 135) and I was able to digitize awesome photos that were left only in film. The colors are true to the original pictures for the most part. Some of the oldest pictures came a little blurry and the colors and lighting somewhat off, but that was the exception and not the rule.
customer_reviews.author: Pakorro

customer_reviews.title: poor value
customer_reviews.text: Does not work as well as the older Slides2U which does not work with Windows 10 (no drivers) This unit's only saving grace is that it has a viewing pane on the front. When loading slides have to use a popsicle stick to help center slide in the scanner. Have tried 2 SD cards and unit still does not save to the card only to its internal memory which holda about 20 slides.
customer_reviews.author: D Quillen

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive And Does a great job !!!
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive scanner does a great job with color slides (I have not yet used the b/w negative feature). But the ease and speed of creating high res jpgs is gratifying. My father's family slides made back in the 1950s have undergone much color shift and while the product lets me make some color correction, I use other editing software to achieve the final crop, contrast, saturation and so forth. But I highly recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy package
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the product yet (Film Scanner) but the first impression is no good: the package is so flimsy, the box fell apart before I opened it. Now I have to find a container to store it. I just hope this will be my only disappointment with the product. So, for now just one star for the package. If it will work well as promised I'll edit my review.
customer_reviews.author: Californian

customer_reviews.title: great neg-film / picture/ slide digitizer
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price, easy to use, nice hi res jpgs. great product but you should do color corrections before you save.
customer_reviews.author: JWG

customer_reviews.title: Workable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use but hard to clean the lens. If it gets anything stuck on it, good luck getting it off. Also would be nice if you could hook it up to a laptop for viewing as you go instead of just a TV. Picture quality was ok for my old slides. Biggest drawback is it does cut off the slides so I got a lot cut off heads and bodies if they were too close to the slide edge in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: David Ellis

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to operate. Too many functions from one button. Very confusing. Well made but picture not as bright as I would like for review
customer_reviews.author: Carl Shipley

customer_reviews.title: Poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: The Digitnow slide converter is rather complicated to use. The instructions are poorly written. Obviously English is a second language to the person writing them. Besides that the pictures in the manual are off such poor quality that it is a little difficult to tell what they are referring to. I wish now we had paid more money and hopefully have gotten a better quality of converter.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Kilmer

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well for me.
customer_reviews.text: Having now used it for about 600 slides, its proved to be a great little scanner. the manual is very helpful.reproduces good quality images from my old 35mm slides. also has a brush in case you get any bits of dirt inside......can just brush it clean so theimages are good, very very happy with this scanner. For those wishing to invest more time and effort into the process there are additional menu options to adjust the colour compositions. I could have also spent a little more time and effort in cleaning the negatives before inserting them into the cartridge and scanner.
customer_reviews.author: casil

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love DIGITNOW film & slide scanner. My mother had over 900 slides that she wanted digitized and after buying the scanner, I could scan the slides with ease while watching TV. And downloading them to my computer was even easier. Just make sure to clean the scanner often.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Baker

customer_reviews.title: Buy a flashlight and save your money
customer_reviews.text: takes way to long, blurry, and hard to use. You'd be better off buying a cheap flashlight to look at slides
customer_reviews.author: Bea

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended but.... may be me
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this but, and this may just be me, the results were cloudy and the color balance was off. I was trying to copy some old slides -- a friend lost any photos from "back then" and I was trying to replace those memories. I did have the slides professionally scanned which worked out ....
customer_reviews.author: RoMac

customer_reviews.title: Product is difficult to use for negatives
customer_reviews.text: This product might work well for slides, but my old 35mm film was sometimes curled and this device did not easily feed the film. It was a slow and tedious process. I went back to my Canon scanner which I also thought was slow, but it did a much better job.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: 5 star product
customer_reviews.text: There are more expensive scanners out there, but I am very happy with this one as it got the job done and brought some long forgotten negatives to life. Excellent image quality and easy to use. Only gripe is that it take several seconds to save each image, which can slow down scanning lots of negatives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon user

customer_reviews.title: disappointing
customer_reviews.text: did not magnify slide well, colors distorted, could not display or save properly for larger view on computer screen. waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Was very skeptical of the quality because it was a lot cheaper than the letter choices. I am very impressed. Good quality, pretty easy to use. I don't know if there's a easier way to do it but I have a little bit of difficulty putting the smaller film through.
customer_reviews.author: Kaila Haslam

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: this is the best product. We are in the process of preserving thousands of slides my Dad took over the years and this is helping us do it. I did have alittle trouble getting it to work with the adapter plugged into the wall, but when I plugged it into my Computer as a power source. I love it. I was able to go through the first box pretty quickly and I just started. We got it before they predicted it would arrive which was great. It has been a great way to bond with Dad and bring back and share memories with him. Trying to get them documented before he forgets as he is 89.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: as far as I can see it does not make a vedio.
customer_reviews.text: I expected to transfer my super 8 movies into a digital video. As I just got out a reel today to see what it would do...I could not see how it would make a video....you have to pull the film thru.....and I could not see what was on it with the way it showed up. I only had one slide to digitize it....and it did fine with the slide.
customer_reviews.author: smr

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to convert slides to digital images
customer_reviews.text: I have been putting off converting our slides to digital images for years. Looked at some of the commercial sites but with the number of slides we have it was expensive. This unit makes the conversion easy. Once you get the rhythm of inserting and saving you can convert a number of slides very quickly. It is then simply a matter of taking the SD card out of the unit and saving its content to your computer if that is your preferred method. I would definitely recommend this to a friend. My only (somewhat minor) complaint is the small print in the instruction manual.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome! There is a slight learning curve, but once you get the hang of it, it is really easy. I am in the process of putting boxes of slides onto a memory card. I will then make pictures from the memory card. It is really quick and it will not take me long at all. I may even do some negatives next! This product is an affordable solution for preserving memories!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Caccavale

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth ANYTHING
customer_reviews.text: The viewing screen is ridiculously small, though it was advertised as large. Inserting slides is tedious in the extreme, and awkward as can be. The color shown is TERRIBLE, and I cannot figure out how to adjust the image or save it. Do not buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: debbidiva

customer_reviews.title: Instructions Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to scan some old 35mm slides. Don't count on the instructions to help you out, they are horrible. After some messing around and viewing an on-line video I figured out how to use the scanner. It does a basic job which is all one can expect at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Grayson

customer_reviews.title: Nothing about this item worked!
customer_reviews.text: As if it wasn't bad enough that nothing about this device was operable, there was no way to contact anyone for help. No address, no phone number, no troubleshooting page. To make matters worse, I just saw that I have missed the window of time to return, now that I also just found the page I'm currently on! So frustrating to now be stuck with a $68.00 unusable device. I was hoping I could at least have the option to trade it up for a better version
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This product was delivered on time from Amazon. It was very easy to use and produced clear photo downloads from slides. The internal memory of the device hold about 22-24 photos before you have to download to the computer. If you purchased a memory card you could scan a lot more. In total I scanned about 150 slides and it took me a a few hours. It would have been faster if I used a memory card. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Elisa F.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little portable device for digitizing my old 35 mm slides. It is very difficult today to find any local service that will convert my old slides to print or digital format. Quality was very good. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Decent negative to digital converter
customer_reviews.text: It is very helpful in the sense that you can convert your old negatives to digital and save for ever. However, it crops off a little from the sides. Otherwise I would have given it a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: AlokG

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to scanning services
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty well once you figure out how to use it. The instructions are not very good.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred B. Loranz

customer_reviews.title: The transfer of slide color and detail is very good, but......
customer_reviews.text: VERY poorly packaged, with some damage to the unit. Still able to use, but will not work, to display slides, without being connected, directly, to power. It should operate from being charged.
customer_reviews.author: gjteach

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - but beware the lint brush!
customer_reviews.text: My slides were in very good shape, so it was pretty easy to use. I scanned 450 slides. Warning - however. The instructions say to clean the lens with the lint brush, but not clear which way to insert it, and I got it stuck. Was able to free it but I can't think this is really critical, especially at first use. in any event, I believe the brush should go facing down, not up, but again, this part of the instructions not clear. In fact, in terms of how to use it, I actually found watching on line videos to be most helpful. So check them out.
customer_reviews.author: ACT
